title: Here’s What You Have to Do If You Want a Selfie with Justin Bieber - Video
content:
It’s all about respect, star tells fans in SnapChat video   
If you’re a Belieber, the first thing you have to remember if you ever see your idol, Justin Bieber, is that he doesn’t like screaming girls fans. He also doesn’t like being pressured into taking selfies with the fans, saying in a new video that an open request for a photo would do a better job at convincing him. 
 
Because wherever he goes chaos ensues, Justin went through the trouble of putting together a SnapChat video (see below), in which he lays out some ground rules for fans, for their interaction with him. 
 
First of all, Justin says that respect is the most important: he wants his Beliebers to enjoy the experience of meeting him, but he will turn his back on them and not even acknowledge their presence if they become too unruly. 
 
It might sound ridiculous for a celebrity to issue guidelines for fans, but this is Justin Bieber we’re talking about. His fans are known to be very passionate and hysteric, to the point where he can’t take a walk from a store to his car without dozens of them running towards him, crying, yelling his name and clutching their phones in the hope they might score a selfie. 
 
Justin actually makes a lot of sense in saying these things on camera, in the hope that they might not fall on deaf Belieber ears.
